When Rand returned to Shadar Logoth weeks later to fight [Sammael](#Sammael), he discovered that Liah was still alive, if not completely sane anymore. He killed her with balefire when she was attacked by Mashadar.

name: Liandrin
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah, formerly of the Red. She has light hair and a face like a doll. She grew up in Tarabon. She led the group of thirteen Aes Sedai who declared themselves Black Ajah and fled the White Tower, murdering guards and even sisters in the process. Liandrin was Red Ajah before turning to the Black, but her oath to the Black was sworn before even being raised to the Accepted (perhaps before she came to the Tower), so it cannot really be said that she was ever Red Ajah at all. When she attempted to Compel [Moghedien](#Moghedien), she was flogged with the Power and then shielded so she could effectively never channel again. She is now _da'covale_, a slave to [Suroth](#High-Lady-Suroth-Sabelle-Meldarath).

name: Lieutenant Tiras
info: [Bakuun](#Assid-Bakuun)'s bony First Lieutenant. He is a full head taller than his commanding officer.

name: Lini Eltring
info: Childhood nurse to Maighdin, [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand), and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) Trakand. She has many wise sayings, which Elayne and Morgase are fond of quoting to themselves and others (probably because they have been ingrained into their minds so much). She went with Morgase when she fled Andor to Amadicia.

name: Lioness
info: [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)'s horse.

name: Lisaine Jarath
info: Gray-haired woman from Seandar. She has a pale, plump face and blue eyes. She accompanies [Miraj](#Captain-General-Kennar-Miraj).

name: Logain Ablar
info: A false [Dragon](#The-Dragon) who created war in Ghealdan and surrounding nations before being captured and gentled by the Red Ajah. He got loose during the chaos surrounding the deposing of [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche), and eventually was escorted out of Tar Valon by Siuan and her traveling companions. Before he was gentled he was of considerable strength, and attracted quite a following of loyal soldiers. [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) still has viewings of him with a halo over his head, which she thinks indicates that he will become a figure of great power sometime in the future. Recently, Logain has come forward with information that indicates the Red Ajah actually put him up to declaring himself the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), most likely with the pretext that bringing down a false Dragon would bring more glory than gentling a simple man who could channel. Logain was recently Healed by [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran), and was let free by [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) to do as he pleased; he went to join the rest of the Asha'man in the Black Tower.

name: Lomas
info: [Baldhere](#Lord-Baldhere)'s scout. He is shy. He wears a foxhead crest on his helmet.

name: Lord Agelmar Jagad
info: [Easar](#King-Easar-Togita)'s general in Shienar. He is possibly the best military commander alive (excepting possibly [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and the Aiel chiefs).

name: Lord Alesune Chulin
info: [Easar](#King-Easar-Togita)'s other escort to the meeting of the Borderland rulers. Slim and fiery, he has long black hair with white streaks in it. He is the Shatayan of Fal Moran Palace.

name: Lord Amondrid Osiellin
info: Lord of Cairhien. He supported [Colavaere](#Lady-Colavaere-Saighan) when she claimed Sun Throne.

name: Lord Baldhere
info: Swordbearer to [Ethenielle](#Queen-Ethenielle-Kirukan-Materasu) of Kandor. He holds the Sword of Kirukan. He is slender and has white hair at his temples. He has a biting tongue. After Ethenielle's husband died, she chose him to command her army in his place.

name: Lord Bertain Gallenne
info: Commander of [Berelain](#Berelain-sur-Paendrag-Paeron)'s Winged Guards, and her personal bodyguard of sorts.

name: Lord Bertome Saighan
info: Short, ruggedly handsome lord of Cairhien with the front of his head shaved. He is [Colavaere](#Lady-Colavaere-Saighan)'s cousin, and since her death has become High Seat of House Saighan.

name: Lord Brend
info: Leader of the Council of Nine until [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s army conquered the city. Some of his troops are still loyal to him, despite the fact that they have been informed of his true identity, [Sammael](#Sammael).

name: Lord Captain Commander Pedron Niall
info: Former Lord Captain Commander of the Children of the Light, highest officer among the Children. He was one of the great military commanders of the world, in company with [Davram Bashere](#Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere), [Agelmar Jagad](#Lord-Agelmar-Jagad), [Rodel Ituralde](#Lord-Rodel-Ituralde), [Gareth Bryne](#Lord-Gareth-Bryne), [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), and several Aiel chiefs. He was trying to get Altara and Murandy to cede land to Illian so the Council of Nine would not invade both countries. He also tried to expand Amadicia's borders into parts of Ghealdan. His headquarters were in Amadicia, and he ruled there even above [King Ailron](#Ailron), although this was not spoken of openly. Niall recently offered a treaty with [Queen Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) of Andor, offering Whitecloak assistance to retake her throne in exchange for Whitecloak presence in Caemlyn and elsewhere in Andor, a presence that Morgase had not allowed even a fraction of during her reign. Niall was killed by his alleged Spymaster, Abdel Omerna, who claimed he had gone against everything the Children stood for by allowing Morgase to avoid being put to the question. He was replaced by [Eamon Valda](#Eamon-Valda), who also killed Omerna. Rumor puts him dead in a duel or a skirmish.

name: Lord Cian do Mehon a'Macansa
info: Murandian lord with a greasy, curled mustache. He is stocky. He meets [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) and her army along with [Pelivar](#Pelivar-Coelan) and [Arathelle](#Arathelle-Renshar).

name: Lord Culhan Carand
info: [Aemlyn](#Lady-Aemlyn-Carand)'s husband.

name: Lord Dalthanes Annallin
info: Lord of Cairhien. He supported [Colavaere](#Lady-Colavaere-Saighan) when she claimed Sun Throne.

name: Lord Dobraine Taborwin
info: Cairienin lord. He is the High Seat of House Taborwin, and commanded the troops [Perrin](#Lord-Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) leads. He is little taller than [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw). He keeps the front of his head shaved, and keeps the gray hair on the sides to his shoulders. He rules Cairhien in [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s absence.

name: Lord Donel do Morny a'Lordeine
info: Lord of Murandy with curled mustaches. He meets [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) and her army along with [Pelivar](#Pelivar-Coelan) and [Arathelle](#Arathelle-Renshar).

name: Lord Doressin Chuliandred
info: Lord of Cairhien. He supported [Colavaere](#Lady-Colavaere-Saighan) when she claimed Sun Throne.

name: Lord Gaebril
info: Man who came to Caemlyn just as riots sprang up throughout the city. He joined and led the faction that restored order in the city, and upon [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand)'s return, he gave her her kingdom in one piece, as it was when she left. Allegedly, she was so happy that he had done this that she made Gaebril her new advisor. However, during [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s trip through Caemlyn to deliver [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)'s letter, Mat overheard Gaebril ordering someone to kill Elayne and anyone else with her—he tried to find a way to report this information to Morgase, but ended up telling Elayne. Gaebril was discovered to be [Rahvin](#Rahvin), one of the Forsaken, who has a preference to having pretty women around him. His “pretty woman” is Morgase, and he planned to wrest control of Andor from her. Morgase realized he was controlling her and left the country so quickly a rumor sprang up that she had been killed; when Caemlyn was taken by [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and Rahvin killed, the rumor changed to say that Rand had killed Morgase, instead of Gaebril.

name: Lord Gareth Bryne
info: Former First Prince of the Sword and Captain of the Queen's Guards under [Queen Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) in Andor. He was appointed to the position because Morgase had no living male relatives, but was exiled from Caemlyn on a suggestion from Morgase's new advisor, [Lord Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril). He moved to his private estates in rural Andor, where he presided over the trial of three young women who unintentionally burned a barn: they turned out to be [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche), the former [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat); [Leane Sharif](#Leane-Sharif), the former [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles), and [Min Farshaw](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw). When these three made an oath to serve him and then apparently broke it, he followed them out of sheer curiosity to Salidar. Once their, he discovered the true identity of the three, as well as that the Tower was truly broken. The Aes Sedai in Salidar persuaded him to command the army they would need to take the Amyrlin Seat from [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan), since he was the only commander that the Warders thought would be willing and able to help them. He is one of the six best military commanders west of the Aiel Waste, in a league with [Pedron Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall), [Rodel Ituralde](#Lord-Rodel-Ituralde), [Davram Bashere](#Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere), [Agelmar Jagad](#Lord-Agelmar-Jagad), and [Matrim Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon). Although neither of them would admit it, Bryne seems to be developing feelings for Siuan Sanche; he wishes to avoid another mistake like his relationship as [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand)'s lover, and also never forgave Siuan for when she publicly shamed him years ago. She seems to be developing similar feelings for him, much to her dismay. He plans to be the first ever general to take the city of Tar Valon; the closest anyone else ever came was with Guaire Amalasan's armies, who got as far as the White Tower itself, and [Artur Hawkwing](#High-King-Artur-Hawkwing), who never managed to go beyond beseiging the city. Actually, Amalasan's troops never beseiged the city, they simply managed to breech the walls; Hawkwing never managed to stop the supply ships coming up the river. Bryne believes he will be able to overcome this problem.

name: Lord Gregorin Panar de Lushenos
info: Member of the Council of Nine. After the death of [Sammael](#Sammael) at [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s hands, he was made the leader of the Council.

name: Lord Jarid Sarand
info: [Elenia](#Elenia-Sarand)'s husband. A square-faced man, he is dark for an Andorman. During the Succession, Jared's House opposed [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand); after she became Queen, he was only allowed into the Palace on state occasions. When [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) killed [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril) and took control of Caemlyn until he could find [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), Jarid tried to make himself fall into favor, thinking he could gain power with the new ruler. His wife Elenia has been exiled, but if she attempts to claim the throne, Elayne expects him to assist her.

name: Lord Jeordwyn Semaris
info: Member of the Council of Nine in Illian. He has a narrow jaw, and stays clean shaven.

name: Lord Luan Norwelyn
info: Andoran noble, leader of a strong House that supported [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. Morgase exiled him from Caemlyn as per [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril)'s suggestion, but hopes he will still support her when she comes to claim the throne. [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) also hopes he will support _her_ claim to the throne.

name: Lord Marac
info: Wide man with a stolid manner. New to the Council of Nine.

name: Lord Paitr do Fearna a'Conn
info: Murandian lord who met [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) and her army along with [Pelivar](#Pelivar-Coelan) and [Arathelle](#Arathelle-Renshar).

name: Lord Perrin t'Bashere Aybara
info: A young man from Emond's Field. He is _ta'veren_. When he and [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) got separated from the rest of the group while fleeing the Trollocs on Winternight, Perrin met a man named [Elyas Machera](#Elyas-Machera). Elyas, a former Warder who found he could talk to wolves, helped Perrin discover the same ability in himself. Perrin's eyes are now yellow, just like the wolves' eyes, and he can enter what he calls the Wolf Dream (known to most as _Tel'aran'rhiod_, the World of Dreams) with them. Perrin is a childhood friend of fellow _ta'veren_ [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon). On the way to Tear, Perrin encountered a young woman by the name of Zarine Bashere, a Hunter for the Horn who took the name of [Faile](#Lady-Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara) (which means “Falcon” in the Old Tongue) as a more appropriate name for a Hunter for the Horn. The two are now married. Perrin is a very large man—he was always a big person, which caused him to be very cautious since he found as a child that he could easily hurt other children if his temper got out of hand. His size helps considerably when helping Master Luhhan on his forge, but sometimes gives others the impression that he is slow and stupid. He returned to the Two Rivers for a time to repel the series of Trolloc attacks; he and his wife are recognized as Lord and Lady there, the first noblility of the Two Rivers since the Trolloc Wars. Perrin was instrumental in freeing Rand from his entrapment at Dumai's Wells; the two had a fight afterwards (they had planned it as a way for Perrin to leave, although they most likely did not plan on it being as violent as it was), and Perrin went to Ghealdan to see if he could tame [Masema](#Masema-Dagar).

name: Lord Rodel Ituralde
info: Commander of Arad Doman's army. He is among the best military commmanders in the entire world.

name: Lord Rodrivar Tihera
info: Lean noble from Tear (very minor noble). Dark even for a Tairen, he has a short beard trimmed to a point. He is the Captain of the Stone of Tear, the man who leads the Defenders.

name: Lord Semaradrid Maravin
info: Cairhienin lord. He has dark eyes. He dislikes Tairens, and sees all of them with contempt.

name: Lord Talmanes Delovinde
info: A Cairhienin military commander, about three years older than [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and about a head shorter. His _con_ is three yellow stars on a blue field. His banner is a black fox. He rarely smiles, and reminds Mat of a compressed spring. He commands about half of Mat's cavalry in the Band of the Red Hand, and acts as the leader of the entire Band in Mat's absence.

name: Lord Telabin
info: Owner of a palace with a garden that [Queen Alliandre](#Queen-Alliandre-Maritha-Kigarin) of Ghealdan frequents.

name: Lord Toram Riatin
info: Cairhienin lord, son of King Galldrian. He is a Blademaster. He opposed [Colavaere](#Lady-Colavaere-Saighan), and is in league with [Caraline](#Lady-Caraline-Damodred) and [Darlin](#High-Lord-Darlin-Sisnera) against [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Lord of the Morning
info: Title by which [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) was known by during the War of the Shadow. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) uses it when he wants to make a point.

name: Losaine
info: Gray-eyed, dark-haired Wise One.

name: Loversknot
info: [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran)'s horse.

name: Lyrelle
info: Sitter for the Blue Ajah in Salidar. She is firmly under [Lelaine](#Lelaine-Akashi)'s influence.

name: M'Hael
info: Title used for [Mazrim Taim](#Mazrim-Taim) as the head of the Black Tower. It means “Leader” in the Old Tongue.

name: Macharan
info: Bear of a man from Andor. He trips over his own boots to avoid [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere).

name: Macu
info: A _raken_ who died at Aes Sedai hands.

name: Madic
info: Balding man with a long face. He served as a servant in [Queen Tylin](#Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar)'s palace.

name: Magla Daronos
info: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah. She is a Sitter, and sits on [Romanda](#Romanda-Cassin)'s side.

name: Maighdin Dorlain
info: A young woman that [Perrin](#Lord-Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) encounters who is fleeing Amadicia. She does not reveal her true identity, [Morgase Trakand](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) of Andor, but uses her mother's name as a disguise. The surname comes from an estate in Andor that Morgase owned before she became Queen.

name: Malien
info: One of the Kin. She is stern-faced and outspoken. She and several other women were going to protest marching until [Reanne](#Reanne-Corly) convinced them that it was better than leaving with no food and no horses.

name: Malind Nachenin
info: Plump Sitter for the Green Ajah among the rebel Aes Sedai. She has a pretty face with full lips and dark, fierce eyes. She was raised after the sisters banded together in Salidar. She once proposed an “appeal” (i.e. demand) to area nobles for assistance in building their army.

name: Mandarb
info: [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran)'s black stallion. His name means “Blade” in the Old Tongue.

name: Manel Rochaid
info: Second in commmand to [Gedwyn](#Charl-Gedwyn) in the Asha'man that accompany [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). He is called [Baijan'm'hael](#Baijan-m-hael) by others in the group, which means “Attack Leader” in the Old Tongue.

name: Marline
info: Wise One with purple twilight eyes. She comes with [Perrin](#Lord-Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara).

name: Martine Janata
info: Aes Sedai of unknown (most likely Brown) Ajah. She was the last sister to _really_ study _ter'angreal_. She did so for over forty years, and was very careful. She was found burned out and unconscious by her maid; her memory of the entire preceeding week was erased.

name: Martyn Tallanvor
info: One of [Maighdin](#Maighdin-Dorlain)'s companions. He is actually a tall young man from Andor who served in the Queen's Guards until [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) fled Andor. When [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril) had the guards swear new oaths to the laws and customs of Andor (instead of to the Queen), Tallanvor swore them but immediately went back to his room and reswore the old oath in the old style (cutting his arm with his sword, indicating that his blood will be shed before the Queen's will). He loves his queen more than his life, and now serves as her personal bodyguard.

name: Masema Dagar
info: The [Prophet](#The-Prophet-of-the-Dragon). He was once one of [Uno](#Uno-Nomesta)'s underlings, and the one who respected [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) the least, but after he found out that Rand was the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), he went his own way, preaching of Rand's glory as the “Lord Dragon Reborn.” Rand has since dispatched [Perrin](#Lord-Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) to bring Masema back into line.

name: Master Hornwell
info: Stout, gray-haired master of the estate where the Aes Sedai stay after being taken from Ebou Dar by [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand).

name: Masuri Sokawa
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She grew up in Arafel, and was part of Salidar's embassy to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). She is now sworn to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), and works as an apprentice to the Wise Ones.

name: Matrim (Mat) Cauthon
info: A young man from Emond's Field. He is _ta'veren_. Along with his good friends, [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Perrin Aybara](#Lord-Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara), he left home to escape the Trolloc attacks after Winternight. On the way to Tar Valon, he picked up a dagger from Shadar Logoth tainted with the evil that destroyed Aridhol, which he carried with him for a long time. He was separated from the dagger by Aes Sedai Healing, but doing so caused large gaps in his memory sequence. These gaps were filled and more when he passed through the twisted door to the land of the Eelfinn, where he was granted his three requests: a foxhead medallion that protects him from women's channeling, a way out of the land of the Eelfinn, and the memories of past lifetimes that were the gaps in his memory. Mat's _ta'veren_ qualities manifest themselves particularly well with random events, such as dice games—he almost never loses a toss of the dice, even if the dice are weighted. He has found that battles are the ultimate form of gambling, and along with his newfound memories he can win almost every battle he fights quite decisively. He has four sisters, including Eldrin and Bodewhin, who are 16 and 17, respectively. His father Abell is one of the best archers in the Two Rivers, possibly in the World. Mat has gotten in the habit of carrying concealed knives under his clothes in case he is attacked—his collection would surprise anyone. In the Waste, he met a woman named Melindhra, a Maiden of the Spear from the Shaido Clan. However, she is not the Daughter of the Nine Moons, who Mat is destined to marry according to the Aelfinn; besides, she tried to kill him on orders from her master among the Darkfriends. Mat had to kill her to save his own skin, but regrets it deeply. He also has a scar along his neck from where the Eelfinn tried to kill him—which was also in accordance with what the Aelfinn told him, that he is “to die and live again.” He currently leads an army called the Band of the Red Hand, after the army of King Aemon of old Manetheren, and serves in a way as Rand's personal general—this works well, since Mat seems to be a better general than even [Davram Bashere](#Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere), who has earned his reputation as one of the best commanders alive. Mat does not trust any Aes Sedai, and because of this refuses to take his foxhead medallion off even to take a bath. Mat is currently in Ebou Dar trying to keep an eye on [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) and prevent them from getting themselves killed.

name: Mazrim Taim
info: False [Dragon](#Dragon-Reborn) who wreaked havoc in Saldaea before being captured by Aes Sedai. He later escaped his captors, possibly with Black Ajah assistance (although this remains unconfirmed). Hearing of [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s amnesty, Taim came to Caemlyn and became the head of Rand's school of male channelers. He is almost as strong in the One Power as Rand is. Taim claims to have held off the madness that normally accompanies the taint for almost 35 years—he has been using the One Power for a very long time, and knows several tricks that Rand had not thought of on his own or been taught by [Asmodean](#Asmodean), such as how to test men for the ability. He seems to resent being second to Rand. Among his students, he is known as [M'Hael](#M-Hael), “Leader.”

name: Megairil
info: Character whose wreath, the Wreath of Megairil, is awarded in a footrace.

name: Meira
info: Wise One of the Shaido Aiel, loyal to [Sevanna](#Sevanna).

name: Memara
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah that [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) sent to bully [Tenobia](#Queen-Tenobia-si-Bashere-Kazadi).

name: Mendan
info: Broad-shouldered Aiel who guards [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin) against anyone who might misunderstand her position in the Aiel camp.

name: Meralda
info: One of the Cairhienin women who tries to imitate the Aiel Maidens of the Spear, only using swords instead. She is dark and stocky, and almost as tall as [Faile](#Lady-Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara). From Tear.

name: Merana Ambrey
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah with hazel eyes. She is now an apprentice of the Wise Ones. The events following Dumai's Wells shook her so deeply that [Cadsuane](#Cadsuane-Melaidhrin) thinks she will never quite recover herself.

name: Meri
info: One of [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s maids as the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat). She has a pinched nose, dark eyes, and black hair. She was chosen by [Romanda](#Romanda-Cassin). She seems to have wandered off.

name: Merilille Ceandevin
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah. Slender and palely elegant, she has glossy black hair and large liquid eyes. She grew up in Cairhien. She was sent to Ebou Dar to convince the queen to support Salidar. She is currently traveling with [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran).

name: Merya
info: Woman who [Elyas](#Elyas-Machera) lived with for a year. She is from Saldaea. She said he was too restrained for her, and even gave him a knife scar for his trouble....

name: Mesaana
info: One of the Forsaken. During the Age of Legends, Mesaana was told she was unfit to do research at the Collam Daan, but was capable of teaching others. She spent her years teaching until the Bore was opened and she dedicated her life to the [Dark One](#Dark-One). During the War of Power, she created “schools” for the children, at which she taught the children to spy on their parents and other such things. After her release from the Bore, Mesaana set herself up in the White Tower, where she could control events without anyone suspecting she was behind them. She has been cooperating with [Semirhage](#Semirhage) to some extent, and has taught [Alviarin](#Alviarin-Freidhen) to Travel.

name: Metarra din Junalle
info: Big-eyed Sea Folk Windfinder apprentice. She is as strong in the One Power as [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) is. She is plump yet solid.

name: Miren
info: One of [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw)'s aunts. She said that one of three lies that men will believe from a woman is that she likes being held just as much as having sex.

name: Mistress Dill
info: Round innkeeper of Cullen's Crossing, an inn in Harbor Bridge.

name: Mistress Hornwell
info: Wife of [Master Hornwell](#Master-Hornwell). She is less stout and gray than her husband, but otherwise very similar.

name: Mistress Jara Doweel
info: [Toveine](#Toveine-Gazal)'s mistress while serving twenty years of penance in the Black Hills.

name: Mistress of Novices
info: The Aes Sedai who is in charge of training novices in the White Tower. The post was held by [Sheriam Bayanar](#Sheriam-Bayanar) of the Blue Ajah until a coup that deposed [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) chased her out of the Tower. The post is now held by [Silviana Brehon](#Silviana-Brehon) in Tar Valon and [Tiana Noselle](#Tiana-Noselle) among the Aes Sedai who fled to Salidar.

name: Mistress of the Ships
info: Commander of the entire fleet of Sea Folk vessels. The post is held by the formidable [Nesta din Reas Two Moons](#Nesta-din-Reas-Two-Moons).

name: Modarra
info: Wise One of the Shaido Aiel. She would be slim if she was not taller than [Someryn](#Someryn). Since she is, she can only be called lean.

name: Moghedien
info: One of the Forsaken. Her name means “Spider” in the Old Tongue. She always works from safety, attacks from safety, and will run unless she can do so. She developed a command of _Tel'aran'rhiod_ that surpassed even Lanfear's mastery—in the real world, Lanfear was more powerful, but even she could not top Moghedien in the World of Dreams. After being released from the Bore, Moghedien eventually found herself in Tanchico, in the Palace of the Panarch of Tarabon. While there, she chanced upon [Nynaeve al'Meara](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran), who was trying to save the Panarch at the time and take the seal on the [Dark One](#Dark-One)'s prison from its hold in the Palace. She and Nynaeve fought in a duel to the last, and Nynaeve managed to better Moghedien, much to the surprise of both of them. She managed to escape Nynaeve's tied off shield, and on their next encounter, this one in _Tel'aran'rhiod_, she ripped [Birgitte](#Birgitte)'s soul out of the World of Dreams after Birgitte almost killed her. On her third encounter with Nynaeve, Nynaeve managed to trap Moghedien with an _a'dam_. Moghedien remained bound by that _a'dam_ in Salidar, disguised as Marigan, but was released by [Halima](#Halima-Saranov). Halima was actually one of the Forsaken, and she took Moghedien to Shayol Ghul to be bound by a _coursouvra_, a Mind Trap, controlled by [Moridin](#Moridin).

name: Moiraine Damodred
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah. Born of a noble House in Cairhien, she is Taringail Damodred's youngest half-sister, and [King Laman](#King-Laman-Damodred)'s niece. She is considered short among her people, and the Cairhienin are already a short people. When it was discovered that she had the ability to channel inborn, Moiraine went to Tar Valon to become an Aes Sedai. Just before being raised to the shawl, she and her friend [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) witnessed Gitara Moroso's Foretelling of the Rebirth of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon). Moiraine and Siuan walked away from each other and did not speak to each other again (at least in public), but both held secret communication with each other and dedicated their lives to finding and guiding the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn). Moiraine found the young man she sought on Winternight in Emond's Field, a young man named [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), along with two more _ta'veren_, [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Perrin Aybara](#Lord-Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) and two women with the spark of the Power inborn, [Egwene al'Vere](#Egwene-al-Vere) and [Nynaeve al'Meara](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran). When Moiraine was shortly raised to the shawl, she met [al'Lan Mandragoran](#al-Lan-Mandragoran), the uncrowned King of Malkier, who was fighting alone against the Shadow in the Blight; she asked Lan to become her Warder, and he accepted. She is very strong in the Power, stronger than almost all living Aes Sedai. In the Stone of Tear, Moiraine confronted and killed the Forsaken Be'lal with balefire, just before he would have killed Rand. Later, after having an inkling of the future events from the testing _ter'angreal_ for the Wise Ones, Moiraine managed to push the Forsaken Lanfear through the twisted doorway _ter'angreal_. Other Aes Sedai consider her a legend, not only for discovering the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) but for defeating two of the Forsaken as well. Despite her efforts, and for the most part, success, [Cadsuane](#Cadsuane-Melaidhrin) still thinks she “bungled” things with Rand.

name: Moria Karentanis
info: Sitter for the Blue Ajah among the rebel Aes Sedai. She proposed stopping pay for soldiers to save money. She is older than all other sitters except [Romanda](#Romanda-Cassin). She grew up in Illian.

name: Moridin
info: Name given to the reincarnation of one of the Forsaken. His name means “Death” in the Old Tongue; no one deserves the name more. He is fond of using the True Power, the power drawn directly from the [Dark One](#Dark-One); the _saa_ have already appeared in his eyes, yet he still controls his use of the True Power (most thought it impossible to avoid drawing too much of it once the _saa_ appeared).

name: Morvrin
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She is stout, and has graying hair. She is one of the six sisters who controls much of the action in Salidar, despite not being part of the Hall of the Tower.

name: Myrelle Berengari
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah with an elliptical face. She is young (she has worn the shawl for about fifteen years), and has four Warders named Nuhel, Croi, Avar, and most recently [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran), [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred)'s old Warder, whom she is trying to save. She treats all of them as husbands in defiance of all law and custom, inside the Tower and out. She fled the White Tower when [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) was deposed, along with most of her Ajah. She is one of the six sisters who hold much of the power in Salidar despite not being part of the Hall of the Tower. She received [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran)'s bond after [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred)'s death, bringing her Warder count to four, at least until [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) is ready to have him as a Warder. She seems to be the resident expert on saving Warders; three of her four (Nuhel, Avar, and Lan) were previously bonded to other sisters.

name: Myriam Copan
info: [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat) years ago, 754–797 of the New Era. Raised from the Green Ajah. She was one of only a handful of Amyrlins to become strong when starting out from a position of weakness.

name: Nadoc
chapter: Chapter 23: Fog of Ware, Storm of Battle
info: Big man with a deceptively mild face.

name: Nae'blis
info: One who will stand only a step below the [Dark One](#Dark-One) on the Day of Return. The position was offered of all of the Chosen if they completed their duties as assigned, but now the Nae'blis has been chosen: [Moridin](#Moridin).

name: Naean Arawn
info: Slim, palely beautiful Andoran noble with big, blue eyes and waves of black hair. She sneers a lot. She opposed [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. [Dyelin](#Dyelin-Taravin) exiled her from Caemlyn, as Morgase did long ago, for attempting to take the Lion Throne.

name: Naime
info: Sea Folk Windfinder.

name: Naiselle
info: One of the Kin. She works as a cool-eyed banker.

name: Nandera
info: Sinewy Maiden of the Spear with graying blonde hair. She led the Maidens of the Spear that came to rescue [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), and later assisted in his beating.

name: Nazelle
info: [Ethenielle](#Queen-Ethenielle-Kirukan-Materasu)'s older sister. She arranged her wedding when she was younger than [Tenobia](#Queen-Tenobia-si-Bashere-Kazadi).

name: Nazran
info: One of [Graendal](#Graendal)'s servants.

name: Nerith
info: One of the _sul'dam_ that accompanies [Bakuun](#Assid-Bakuun). He is square-faced. He was captured by [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and his army near Illian.

name: Nesair
info: Fiery-haired Maiden of the Spear. She assisted in [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s beating. She is beautiful despite sun-dark cheeks. She was originally of the Shaido, but stayed with her warrior society when the Shaido went amok.

name: Nesta din Reas Two Moons
info: [Mistress of the Ships](#Mistress-of-the-Ships) of the Atha'an Miere. She is used to getting what she wants, with good reason.

name: Nesune Bihara
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She is one of the Aes Sedai now sworn to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor); she assisted in his kidnapping. She always listens to all sides before drawing any conclusions, and she remembers _everything_. She is slender, has black eyes, and grew up in Kandor. [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) had a viewing of her: she will found a library.

name: Nevarin
info: Wise One with green eyes. She goes with [Perrin](#Lord-Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) to seek out [Masema](#Masema-Dagar).

name: Nianh
info: Aes Sedai of unknown Ajah and former advisor to [Queen Ethenielle](#Queen-Ethenielle-Kirukan-Materasu) of Kandor. She told Ethenielle that the Kandori Spire was a remnant of the Age of Legends and probably harmless. She disappeared without a trace after news of [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan)'s deposition of [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) and her subsequent ascension to the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat).

name: Nildra
info: Wiry servant from the Aes Sedai camp.

name: Nip
info: [Bakuun](#Assid-Bakuun)'s favorite wolfhound. He sees him on a level with a _damane_ (or, more accurately, a _damane_ on a level with Nip).

name: Nisao Dachen
info: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah. She agreed to assist [Myrelle](#Myrelle-Berengari) with helping [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran) because of problems she foresaw with his mind. Her specialty as a Yellow sister is psychiatric problems. She tried to help [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) with her headaches, but could not find the cause of them.

name: Norlea
info: Wise One of the Shaido Aiel.

name: Norley
info: One of the male channelers who sides with [Logain](#Logain-Ablar); he helped put down the Aes Sedai “invasion.”

name: Olver
info: A boy of nine who sat on the wrong horse and almost had his neck broken for the trouble. He is adopted after a fashion by [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and his Band of the Red Hand. His parents were killed when the Shaido ravaged Cairhien.

name: Ortis
info: Squadman in the Winged Guards of Mayene.

name: Osan'gar
info: Name given to the reincarnation of one of the Forsaken. It was the left-hand dagger in a form of dueling popular right after the creation of the Bore. The sport fell from common practice, since almost invariably both duelists died from the slow poison on the daggers. Osan'gar states that he helped make the Trollocs.

name: Padan Fain
info: Former peddler that frequently came to Emond's Field. A Darkfriend, he was given orders to locate the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) and narrowed the list of candidates to to three boys in Emond's Field. While persuing them, he encountered the spirit of Mordeth in Aridhol, now called Shadar Logoth. Mordeth attempted to consume Fain's soul, but instead the two souls merged, producing something more evil than either of them alone. Fain no longer takes his orders from the Shadow; he has his own evil agenda. It is said, “The look of the Eyeless is fear,” from observing that a Myrddraal's look causes fear in the hearts of men. Fain's look has that effect on Myrddraal—Fades feel the same fear of Fain as men feel from a Fade. Fain is also called Ordeith, a name he adopted to become a Whitecloak officer. He is perhaps the most evil man alive. He now serves as advisor to [Toram Riatin](#Lord-Toram-Riatin), one of the Cairhienin nobles in rebellion to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). Rand has a bounty of 100,000 gold crowns on his head—Fain killed Rand's friends because they were his friends, he pillaged his homeland because it was his homeland, and Rand intends to see him dead for it.

name: Parelean
info: A man from Tear who travels with [Faile](#Lady-Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara).

name: Pelivar Coelan
info: Andoran noble, leader of a strong House that supported [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. Morgase exiled him from Caemlyn as per [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril)'s suggestion, but hopes he will still support her when she comes to claim the throne. He is one of the lords in Andor who arrested [Naean](#Naean-Arawn) and [Elenia](#Elenia-Sarand) for claiming the Lion Throne; he later led the Andoran troops that confronted the Aes Sedai led by [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere).

name: Peral Torval
info: Asha'man who comes with a message for [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). He is close to his middle years, and has a sharp nose. He grew up in Tarabon. When he first met [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), he tried to pick a fight with him, but was punished by [Taim](#Mazrim-Taim) before he could cause any trouble.

name: Pevara Tazanovni
info: Sitter for the Red Ajah in Tar Valon. She was friends with [Seaine](#Seaine-Herimon) as a novice; the two maintained the friendship, although it was a bit restrained due to the constraints that the Red Ajah puts on its members about making friends outside the Ajah. She is short for a Kandori, and quite plump. She has dark eyes. She was once punished for voicing her desire to have a Warder; later, as a Sitter, when she was safer from the wrath of the Ajah, she openly suggested that Warders would make the job of a Red sister much easier. Seaine thinks she would have been happier as a Green. When she was small, many members of her family were killed by Darkfriends; it is for this reason that Seaine confides in her about searching for Darkfriends in the White Tower, as well as the reason she chose the Red Ajah; she thought it would be the way surest to let her hunt down Darkfriends.

name: Pol
info: [Merilille](#Merilille-Ceandevin)'s maid.

name: Queen Alliandre Maritha Kigarin
info: Blessed of the Light, Queen of Ghealdan, Defender of Garen's Well. She is the fourth person to sit on the throne of Ghealdan in the past seven months. She wears jewelry to her meetings with [Masema](#Masema-Dagar) for the sole purpose of giving it to him such that he will not ask for anything more; she also sent a letter to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) offering him her friendship and asking for his help.

name: Queen Ethenielle Kirukan Materasu
info: Holder of the Throne of the Clouds of Kandor—that is, the Queen of Kandor.

name: Queen Ishara Maravaile
info: First Queen of Andor, from whom all other queens are descended. Her husband was Souran Maravaile, one of [Artur Hawkwing](#High-King-Artur-Hawkwing)'s best generals. She governed the Province of Andor until Hawkwing's empire finally fell apart and Andor became an independent nation. All of the Andoran nobles are related to her somehow, although most people would not even consider the ones who hold the closest relation to her to be related at all. None of her sons lived past age twenty, hence the tradition of only having a queen in Andor.

name: Queen Kirukan
info: Fabled warrior-Queen of Aramelle. The sword of the King or Queen of Kandor is called the Sword of Kirukan; it may indeed have belonged to her. She allegedly beheaded a false Dragon with her own hands and bore five sons by another male channeler.

name: Queen Menuki Nachiman
info: [Paitar](#King-Paitar-Nachiman)'s wife. He is hers completely; she never had a jealous moment in her marriage, nor cause for one.

name: Queen Morgase Trakand
info: By the Grace of the Light, Queen of Andor, Defender of the Realm, High Seat of House Trakand. Mother of [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand). She married Taringail Damodred, a prince of Cairhien, to further solidify her claim to the Throne of Andor and keep peace between the two nations; when Tigraine disappeared, Morgase made the best claim to succeed her, and married her widower to gain the support that would be gained by such action. Taringail was Elayne's and Gawyn's father; he died when they were young. Morgase has since gone through several lovers, including [Thomdril Merrilin](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin), a former court-bard; [Gareth Bryne](#Lord-Gareth-Bryne), her First Prince of the Sword and Captain of the Guards; and most recently [Lord Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril), a man who led the faction that stilled the riots in Caemlyn that sprang up on Morgase's trip to Tar Valon to inquire about Elayne's whereabouts. Thom was exiled from the city of Caemlyn when he started telling her what he really thought of some of her plans, her relationship with Bryne ebbed away until finally Gaebril told her to exile him too, and Gaebril eventually chased Morgase herself out of the city when she found he was usurping her power. The Daughter-Heir of Andor is traditionally trained by Aes Sedai in the White Tower, and Morgase underwent novice training to keep the tradition alive. She was given the gift of a Great Serpent ring despite not being Accepted, and still wears it on her left hand. She was previously advised by [Elaida do Avriny a'Roihan](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) of the Red Ajah, who is now the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat) in Tar Valon. When Morgase discovered that Gaebril meant to usurp her throne, she left, and when she learned that the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) had taken over Caemlyn and none of her former supporters would give her aid, she fled to Amadicia to get help from the only place she thought she could: [Pedron Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall) and the Children of the Light. She is not aware that [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) only wants to give her country back to her, not to mention believes that she is dead. If she made her presence known, she would no doubt have her country back in one piece and all would be well, but as royalty she believes she must work on her own and trust no one. The entire world believes Morgase dead except for a select few. She is currently in hiding, using her mother's name, [Maighdin](#Maighdin-Dorlain), to avoid instant recognition. Her sign is three golden keys.

name: Queen Tenobia si Bashere Kazadi
info: Queen of Saldaea. She is tall for a woman with an overbold nose, but pretty. She has dark, deep, blue, slanted eyes. She is niece of her Marshal-General, [Davram Bashere](#Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere).

name: Quick
info: [Bashere](#Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere)'s horse.

name: Raefar Kisman
info: One of the Asha'man. He tried to kill [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), along with [Dashiva](#Corlan-Dashiva), [Gedwyn](#Charl-Gedwyn), [Torval](#Peral-Torval), and [Rochaid](#Manel-Rochaid).

name: Rafela Cindal
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah with a round face. She is now sworn to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). She negotiated the treaty with the Sea Folk along with [Merana](#Merana-Ambrey).

name: Rahvin
info: One of the Forsaken. He was fond of using Compulsion, and was known for being a ladies' man—he always had a woman on his arm. After being released from the Bore, he took up residence in Caemlyn as [Lord Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril), and used Compulsion to have [Queen Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) not only make him her advisor, but her lover as well. He eventually planned to take over the country directly as the first ever King of Andor—he did his best to weaken support for Morgase, exiling her supporters and befriending those who opposed her, finally chasing her from the country as well. Shortly after news of Morgase's death or at least abdication reached Cairhien, Rahvin was confronted and killed by [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor) in _Tel'aran'rhiod_ with a weave of balefire strong enough to burn Rahvin's soul out of the pattern for days.

name: Rainyn
info: Round-cheeked Sea Folk Windfinder from a Darter. She is as strong in the One Power as [Lelaine](#Lelaine-Akashi).

name: Rand al'Thor
info: A young man from Emond's Field in the Two Rivers, now proclaimed to be the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn). He is very tall, with curly red-blond hair. He was raised by [Tam al'Thor](#Tamlin-Tam-al-Thor) and his wife Kari (until her death around the time Rand was five) in Emond's Field. His real parents, however, were Janduin, the chief of the Taardad Aiel who brought the four clans across the Dragonwall to punish [Laman](#King-Laman-Damodred)'s Sin, and a Maiden of the Spear named Shaiel, who was actually Tigraine Mantear, the runaway Daughter-Heir of Andor. Tigraine gave birth to Rand on the slopes of Dragonmount, in accordance with prophecy; “born of a Maiden, of the ancient blood but raised by the Old.” Rand has a heron branded into each of his palms, which he received from the sword Tam gave him while fighting Ishamael. He also has two dragons on his forearms, which he recieved in Rhuidean to designate him as the _[Car'a'carn](#Car-a-carn)_, the Chief of Chiefs of the Aiel. He is not only the Dragon Reborn, but also He Who Comes With the Dawn, the man prophesied to reunite the Aiel, and the [Coramoor](#Coramoor), the one prophesied to bring the Sea Folk out of the Sea. He can channel strongly, more so than any person who ever lived (except the previous user of his soul, [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon), who was obviously of equal strength), and is also _ta'veren_, the most strongly so since Lews Therin as well. Lews Therin's voice has somehow found a new place inside of Rand's head; he talks to him in a mad voice when Rand least expects it, sometimes offering sound advice or knowledge, sometimes babbling, sometimes even trying to wrest control of _saidin_ from him. Unlike Lews Therin, Rand is accompanied by two other _ta'veren_ during this turing of the Wheel, two men born within days (hours, even) of him named [Matrim Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Perrin Aybara](#Lord-Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara), who both grew up in Emond's Field as well. Rand is destined to fall in love with three women (and has): [Min Farshaw](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw), [Elayne Trakand](#Elayne-Trakand), and [Aviendha](#Aviendha). Rand has had success in fighting many of the Forsaken; all to confront him have died or been trapped. He killed [Aginor](#Aginor) at the Eye of the World after the Green Man killed Balthamel; he allowed [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) to kill Be'lal in the Stone of Tear, and killed Ishamael in the Stone shortly afterward; in the wagons near the Spine of the World, Lanfear confronted him and was pushed into the land of the Eelfinn by Moiraine; he killed [Rahvin](#Rahvin) in _Tel'aran'rhiod_ when he came to the Royal Palace in Caemlyn; and [Asmodean](#Asmodean), his teacher, was killed shortly after Rahvin met his fate. His prophecies fulfilled grow: he has already been born on the slopes of Dragonmount of a Maiden, of the ancient blood but raised by the old, taken the Stone of Tear and drawn _Callandor_, and began conquering "under the forgotten symbol," that of the Aes Sedai of the Age of Legends. He is working on having the "spotless tower" break and bend knee to him (several Aes Sedai have sworn fealty to him and only him). He is the salvation of the entire world, and as the prophecy states, he _will_ save the world—and Break it again.

name: Reanne Corly
info: Eldest of the Knitting Circle, the ruling group among the women known as the Kin. She has blue eyes, and is quite strong in the One Power; she could match [Sheriam](#Sheriam-Bayanar), [Kwamesa](#Kwamesa), or [Kiruna](#Kiruna-Nachiman). She claims to be 412 years old. Publicly, she arranges shipping for small traders.

name: Reene Harfor
info: Graying First Maid in the Royal Palace in Caemlyn.

name: Renaile din Calon Blue Star
info: Windfinder to the [Mistress of the Ships](#Mistress-of-the-Ships) of the Atha'an Miere.

name: Rhadam Asunawa
info: High Inquisitor for the Hand of the Light. He wants every woman affiliated in any way with the White Tower hanged as of yesterday, every book that mentions Aes Sedai or the White Tower burned, and the very words banned. He would have [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) hanged for her months in the Tower if [Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall) had let him. He witnessed [Eamon Valda](#Eamon-Valda)'s killing of Omerna.

name: Rhiale
info: Wise One of the Shaido Aiel, loyal to [Sevanna](#Sevanna). She has flame-colored hair and blue eyes.

name: Rhuarc
info: Tall, broad-shouldered, blue-eyed clan chief of the Taardad Aiel. He has gray streaks in his red hair. He has two wives: [Amys](#Amys), a Wise One, and Lian, roofmistress of Cold Rocks Hold. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) put him in charge of Cairhien along with [Berelain](#Berelain-sur-Paendrag-Paeron).

name: Rina Hafden
info: [Elyas](#Elyas-Machera)'s Aes Sedai. She is of the Green Ajah.

name: Rolan
info: Aiel warrior who travels with the Shaido. He was the one who took [Faile](#Lady-Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara) _gai'shain_.

name: Romanda Cassin
info: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah with solid gray hair and a high soprano voice. She is the eldest of the Sitters in the Hall of the Little Tower. She came out of her retirement when news of [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) and [Leane](#Leane-Sharif) came to her.

name: Rovair Kirklin
info: [Masuri](#Masuri-Sokawa)'s Warder.

name: Rubinde
info: Sitter for the Green Ajah in Tar Valon. She has raven-black hair and eyes like sapphires. She is from Mayene, and usually looks as though she's ready to walk through a stone wall.

name: Rysael
info: Sea Folk Windfinder.

name: Saerin Asnobar
info: Sitter for the Brown Ajah in Tar Valon. She carries a curved knife, in the fashion of her native Altara. She has touches of white at her dark temples which emphasize a thin, age-faded white scar. Only a Warder could match her for scowling. She has held her chair in the Hall for forty years. Everyone knows to be wary of her temper. She was born the daughter of an innkeeper, and was first trained by the Daughters of Silence (an organization similar to, but shorter-lived and smaller than the Kin)—she was the only one of them to ever obtain the shawl.

name: Salita Toranes
info: Dark-skinned Sitter for the Yellow Ajah among the rebel Aes Sedai. She is from Tear, and is almost as dark as the Sea Folk. She was raised to a Sitter after the sisters banded together in Salidar. She suggested a tax on the towns the Aes Sedai passed through to raise money for the ever-growing army.

name: Samalin
info: Sitter for the Green Ajah among the rebel Aes Sedai.

name: Sammael
info: One of the Forsaken. During the War of the Shadow, he was one of the Shadow's greatest military commanders. His name means “Destroyer of Hope” in the Old Tongue. After being released from the Bore, he took up residence on the Council of Nine in Illian as [Lord Brend](#Lord-Brend), and effectively ruled the country. He wore a battle scar that he got while fighting [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) during the War of the Shadow. He could have had it Healed, but kept it to remind himself of what Lews Therin had done to him. He is believed dead at the hands of Mashadar.

name: Sarainya Vostovan
info: One of the Kin. She has a husky voice, and is not strong enough in the Power to become an Aes Sedai.

name: Sareitha Tomares
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She has worn the shawl only a short time, only about two years. She is in Ebou Dar with [Merilille](#Merilille-Ceandevin). She grew up in Tear, and has brown hair.

name: Sarene Nemdahl
info: Aes Sedai of the White Ajah. She has a temper, but she will admit she is wrong if she is. She taught novice classes on “the nature of reality.” Her Warder is Vitalien. She has a secret love of writing poetry—she would die of shame if Vitalien ever discovered that she compares him to a leopard and other graceful, powerful animals in her poems. She assisted in [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s kidnapping, was captured and shielded after the battle at Dumai's Wells, and is now a prisoner of the Aiel, sworn to Rand. According to [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw)'s viewing, she will fall in love.

name: Saroiya
info: Sitter for the White Ajah in the rebel Hall. She sits on [Romanda](#Romanda-Cassin)'s side.

name: Seaine Herimon
info: Sitter for the White Ajah in Tar Valon. When the Hall was arguing over who to raise as [Amyrlin](#Amyrlin-Seat) years back, it was deadlocked over four candidates who had each worn the shawl about fifty years; the Hall wanted an Amyrlin that was younger than the eighty or more years than were common. Seaine suggested [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche), then a young Blue sister that had worn the shawl for ten years; she was eventually raised. Recently, Seaine has been assigned by [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) to “follow the stench of treason, no matter where it leads or how high, even to the [Keeper](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles) herself.” Seaine interpreted this to mean that she was to root out Darkfriends in the Tower.

name: Sebban Balwer
info: Formerly [Pedron Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall)'s “dry little stick of a secretary.” He was in reality the Master of Spies for the Children of the Light; his identity was known only to Niall. His skills have proven useful to his new traveling group, [Perrin](#Lord-Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) and company.

name: Sedore Dajenna
info: Sitter for the Yellow Ajah in Tar Valon. She has a round face.

name: Segani
info: A _raken_ (Seanchan flying animal) controlled by [Chulein](#Chulein).

name: Selame
info: One of [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s maids as the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat). She is rail-thin. She was chosen for her by [Lelaine](#Lelaine-Akashi), after [Romanda](#Romanda-Cassin) conscripted [Meri](#Meri) into service.

name: Selande Darengil
info: One of [Faile](#Lady-Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara)'s new servants, one of the Cairhienin women who tries to imitate the Aiel Maidens of the Spear, only using swords instead. She is the leader of the _Cha Faile_ (Falcon's Talon) sept of the Aiel imitators.

name: Semirhage
info: One of the Forsaken. During the Age of Legends, she was one of the best Healers ever known. She was called to all corners of the world Heal people that others thought beyond help. However, she was sadistic; she exacted a price in the form of pain from her subjects in return for her Healing services. Most thought the pain or anguish she exacted from them was a small price to pay for being alive, but eventually the Hall of Servants found out about her practices and gave her the choice of being severed or bound with the Power, never again to know her “pleasures.” She chose instead to pledge for the [Dark One](#Dark-One), and created one of the most oppressive and pain-filled areas of Shadow control during the entire War of Power. After being freed from the Bore, Semirhage went in service to the Dark One by extracting information from captured Borderlanders and Aes Sedai. She also sent the Trollocs to the Stone of Tear to battle those that [Sammael](#Sammael) sent. She is as tall as most men, and wears black most of the time—perhaps because Lanfear always wore white. It is often joked (or used to be, when the Forsaken were still bound) that when it rained during the daylight that the Dark One was beating her.

name: Senine din Ryal
info: Sea Folk Windfinder with weathered cheeks and gray hair. She once had six earrings in one ear.

name: Seonid Traighan
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah. She grew up in Cairhien. She was part of Salidar's embassy to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). She has two Warders.

name: Serailla
info: [Ethenielle](#Queen-Ethenielle-Kirukan-Materasu)'s First Councilor. She is stout and calm.

name: Sereille Bagand
info: [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat) of just over a hundred years ago. She was raised from the White Ajah, and was somewhat of a legend. She served as [Mistress of Novices](#Mistress-of-Novices) when [Vandene](#Vandene-Namelle) was still in training, and had a repuatation of being one of the strictest taskmistresses around.

name: Sevanna
info: Wise One of the Jumai sept of the Shaido Aiel. She is the widow of the last two chiefs of the Shaido, Suladric and Couladin. She has green eyes. She knows that the easiest way to power for herself is to attach herself to men who already hold power; she even envisioned marrying [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) (against his will) to gain power through him. She is currently leading her clan (and any Aiel deserters that joined her) through Kinslayer's Dagger.

name: Shai'tan
info: Real name for the Dark One. At the moment of Creation, Shai'tan was imprisoned by the [Creator](#The-Creator) at Shayol Ghul. This prison kept him from touching the world until it was bored into by Aes Sedai during the Age of Legends. This hole, called the Bore, allowed the Dark One to once again touch the world, causing new outbreaks of war, treachery, violence, and crime. The attempt to free the Dark One completely resulted in the War of the Shadow (called the War of Power by some, especially those on the Shadow's side), during which a number of important leaders forsook the Light and gave their lives to the Dark One; these people are known today as the Forsaken, and were 13 of the most powerful Aes Sedai of the Age of Legends. The War of the Shadow did not end until [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon), the [Dragon](#The-Dragon), and his Hundred Companions Traveled to Shayol Ghul and re-sealed the Dark One back into his prison, trapping the Forsaken with him. At the moment of sealing, Shai'tan lashed out at those sealing the prison, driving them insane and tainting _saidin_ itself, the male half of the True Source, dooming all male Aes Sedai to madness as well and starting the Time of Madness. These seals are weakening now, enough that the Forsaken have escaped and the Dark One is once again able to exert influence on the world. These seals were scattered throughout the world by Aes Sedai during the Breaking of the World. In order of when they were found, they were placed: 1) At the Eye of the World (broken when it was found); 2) in the hands of Bayle Domon, later pilfered by High Lord Turak of the Seanchan (broken at the battle of Falme), 3) On Seanchan, part of High Lord Turak's collection (broken at the battle at Falme); 4) In the Great Hold at the Stone of Tear (still intact); 5) In the Panarch's Palace in Tanchico (broken enroute to Salidar); 6) One in Rhuidean (still intact), and 7) Found by [Mazrim Taim](#Mazrim-Taim) on a small farm in Saldaea (still intact). Despite being made of _cuendillar_, the three that remain unbroken can be cut with a knife and would break by a fall from a table. The Dark One is also referred to by other euphemisms, including Sightblinder, Lord of the Grave, Father of Lies, Grassburner, Leafblighter, Heartsbane, Soulsbane, Lord of the Twilight, Father of Storms, Shepherd of the Night, and (among Darkfriends) the Great Lord of the Dark.

name: Shaidar Haran
info: A Myrddraal of special abilities who escorts the Chosen (i.e. Forsaken) to the Pit of Doom to converse with the [Dark One](#Dark-One). He is head and shoulders taller than all other Myrddraal, who are the height of an average man and all the same height. His name means “Hand of the Dark” in the Old Tongue; most Myrddraal names come from the Trolloc tongue. He is given special consideration; the ceiling of the entrance to the Pit of Doom does not brush his head as it does everyone else's.

name: Shalon din Togara Morning Tide
info: Windfinder of Clan Shodein.

name: Sharina Melloy
info: Grandmother recruited as a novice along the way from Salidar to Tar Valon. She has more potential than [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran). _There is a distinct possibility that this Sharina is the same one as the Aes Sedai advisor to Nynaeve and [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran) from Nynaeve's test for being raised to Accepted._

name: Shein Chunla
info: [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat) of about four hundred years ago, just before [Gerra Kishar](#Gerra-Kishar). She was raised from the Green Ajah. She squandered the power of the Amyrlin and was actually deposed and exiled, although the story in public was that she died in office. Four plots attempted to restore her to the Amyrlin Seat; after the fourth, she was smothered in her sleep with a pillow by the sisters guarding her.

name: Sheriam Bayanar
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah with fiery hair. She was [Mistress of Novices](#Mistress-of-Novices) in the White Tower before she fled to Salidar with the rest of her Ajah. She led the group of six sisters that hold most of the influence in Salidar, despite not being part of the Hall of the Tower. Her tilted green eyes can be used to intimidate novices and Aes Sedai alike. She is now the [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles) under [Egwene al'Vere](#Egwene-al-Vere).

name: Shevan
info: Sitter for the Brown Ajah in Tar Valon. She is bonily thin and taller than most men. She has an angular face, long chin, spidery fingers, and curly hair.

name: Sibella
info: One of the Kin. She is scrawny, and has yellow hair.

name: Silviana Brehon
info: [Mistress of Novices](#Mistress-of-Novices) in the White Tower. She is from the Red Ajah, and was appointed by [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) after [Sheriam](#Sheriam-Bayanar) left the Tower. She is stocky, and has a square face.

name: Siuan Sanche
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah. Born in Tear to a fisherman, she was sent to the White Tower on the first boat to leave after she discovered she had the ability to channel inborn, according to Tairen law. As a novice, she was good friends with [Moiraine Damodred](#Moiraine-Damodred), and was present at Gitara Moroso's Foretelling of the Rebirth of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon). After being raised to the shawl, she joined the Blue Ajah to dedicate her life to finding and guiding the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), and eventually came to lead the Blues' network of eyes-and-ears (i.e. spies) before being raised to the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat). She was only thirty years old when raised to the Amyrlin Seat, making her the youngest Amyrlin to date. She was also one of the strongest Amyrlins in recent history, and one of the most feared among the rulers of nations. Her blue-eyed stare was feared by all. When her twenty-year connection to the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) was discovered, she and her [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles), [Leane Sharif](#Leane-Sharif), were deposed and stilled by a group of sisters loyal to [Elaida a'Roihan](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan). Siuan hoped to regain some of her previous standing in the new Tower that separated from Elaida—her knowledge of the Blue Ajah spy network is hard to match, and she knows much that she thinks would be of use. In one of her viewings, [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) saw that Siuan would have to remain close by to [Gareth Bryne](#Lord-Gareth-Bryne)—if she did not, both of them would die. Siuan did not initially know what she meant, but now realizes that she is growing to love the gray-haired man who leads the Salidar army. She had a Warder named Alric, but he died when she was deposed. After coming to Salidar, [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) discovered how to restore Siuan's ability to channel, at least partially. This resurrected a part of her bond with Alric, but did not bring back her former strength, or her binding by the Oath Rod. She can now lie as well as any child. She now serves as an “advisor” to the new Amyrlin in Salidar, [Egwene al'Vere](#Egwene-al-Vere), but though she puts on a façade of hating the work, she is actually one of Egwene's foremost agents. The fact that she is Aes Sedai, not to mention one who was stilled and Healed again, makes other sisters tend to be oblivious to this fact.

name: Somara
info: Flaxen-haired Maiden of the Spear, of the Bent Peak sept of the Daryne Aiel. She is tall even among the Aiel and is the tallest among [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s honor guard. She took part in Rand's beating.

name: Someryn
info: Wise One of the Shaido Aiel. She is as tall as most men, and is fond of revealing dresses and jewelry. She is stronger in the One Power than any woman in the White Tower.

name: Sorilea
info: Wise One of Shende Hold, of the Jarra sept of the Chareen Aiel. She has thin, white hair; tight, leathery skin; and green eyes. She can channel, but weakly. She is about a head taller than [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere). She is the strongest-willed of the Wise Ones—even other Wise Ones scurry to do her bidding, and _no one_ gives her orders.

name: Sparrow
info: [Toveine](#Toveine-Gazal)'s horse.

name: Spiron Narettin
info: Man who commands the Illianer Companions that are with [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Stayer
info: One of [Perrin](#Lord-Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara)'s horses.

name: Stepper
info: One of [Perrin](#Lord-Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara)'s horses.

name: Suana Dragand
info: Sitter for and head of the Yellow Ajah in Tar Valon.

name: Sulin
info: Maiden of the Spear with white hair. She leads [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s honor guard.

name: Sumeko Karistovan
info: One of the Kin. She is a very skilled Healer, and has developed methods of Healing that not even [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) has been able to develop—in fact, the only thing similar would be the methods [Damer Flinn](#Damer-Flinn) has developed among the Asha'man. She is possibly the most skilled female Healer alive outside of [Semirhage](#Semirhage). She is stout.

name: Surasa
info: Near Legendary ancestor of [Queen Ethenielle](#Queen-Ethenielle-Kirukan-Materasu) of Kandor.

name: Swallow
info: [Faile](#Lady-Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara)'s horse.

name: Tai'daishar
info: [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s black gelding. His name means “True Glory” in the Old Tongue.

name: Takima
info: Sitter for the Brown Ajah for almost nine years. She fled Tar Valon when [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) was deposed. She now sits with [Lelaine](#Lelaine-Akashi)'s Sitters. She is short, and has long dark hair to her waist. Her skin is aged and ivory-colored.

name: Talaan din Gelyn
info: Boyishly slim Sea Folk Windfinder apprentice. She is almost as strong in the One Power as [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran). She is [Caire](#Caire-din-Gelyn-Running-Wave)'s daughter.

name: Talene Minly
info: Sitter for the Green Ajah in Tar Valon. She has golden hair, and has a statuesque air. She was friends with [Seaine](#Seaine-Herimon) before the rift that formed between the Ajahs went up. She earned more punishments as a novice than any other woman in history.

name: Tamarla
info: Lean, olive-skinned Kinswoman. She is very old, and grew up in Altara.

name: Tamlin (Tam) al'Thor
info: [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s father. He taught Rand about the Flame and the Void, a trick he uses to concentrate and to win archery competitions; Rand found that it is the way he can gain access to _saidin_. Tam is not actually Rand's biological father; he found Rand as a newborn on the slopes of Dragonmount and took him home with him since Rand's mother was dead. He was at Dragonmount as part of the Aiel War, which he left home to participate in when he was young. He became an officer in the Illianer army, and even achieved Blademaster status, acquiring a heron-mark sword. In fact, [Demetre Marcolin](#First-Captain-Demetre-Marcolin) served under him when he was a Second Captain in the Companions. He married a woman from Caemlyn, Kari, who he met while stationed there. When the Aiel War started, he fought Aiel all the way to Tar Valon and the Battle of the Shining Walls, where he found Rand on the mountain. Tam and Kari raised Rand as their own son. Tam always won the archery competitions (or came in second to Abell Cauthon), and passed his archery skills on to Rand. He also taught [Aram](#Aram) how to use his sword. Tam had no idea that the child he was raising was the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn).

name: Tamra Ospenya
info: [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat) before Sierin Vayu, raised from the Blue Ajah. She was interrogated by Jarna Malari, then the head of the Black Ajah, and made to appear to have died in her sleep. Her [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles) was Gitara Moroso; she was one of only three people present at Gitara's Foretelling of the Rebirth of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon). This may be the information that Jarna was trying to extract from her; it may also be the reason Ishamael killed Jarna for killing Tamra.

name: Tauan
info: A _morat'raken_ who died at Aes Sedai hands.

name: Tebreille din Gelyn South Wind
info: Windfinder to a Clan Wavemistress. She is [Caire](#Caire-din-Gelyn-Running-Wave)'s sister and [Talaan](#Talaan-din-Gelyn)'s aunt.

name: Teryl Wynter
info: One of [Seonid](#Seonid-Traighan)'s Warders. He has dark, reddish hair, a curled mustache, and _very_ blue eyes.

name: Teslyn Baradon
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah from Illian. She has a sharp face, narrow shoulders, gaunt cheeks, and a narrow nose. She was a Sitter for the Red for fifteen years until [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) was raised and asked her to step down from the Hall. Elaida sent her to Ebou Dar to meet with [Queen Tylin](#Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar) of Altara.

name: The Creator
info: The maker of the Universe, people, places, things, the True Source, everything in existence. An alternative name would be God. After He created the world, the Creator made a prison for [Shai'tan](#Dark-One), the Dark One, His complete opposite in every way, to keep him from influencing the world. The Creator is bent on non-interference—He will not directly influence events in the world, instead using a “[Chosen One](#Chosen-One)” or simply tugging at the Pattern of the Age in hopes that what He wants to occur will occur, instead of just making it happen. The Forsaken and most Darkfriends consider Him to be inferior to the Dark One, despite the fact that He imprisoned him.

name: The Dragon
info: Name by which [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) was known during the War of the Shadow. His rebirth, the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), is now alive and fulfilling all of the prophecies set to accompany him.

name: The Empress (of Seanchan)
info: The supreme ruler of Seanchan. She is considered to be a direct descendant of the first Emperor of Seanchan, [Luthair Paendrag Mondwhin](#Emperor-Luthair-Paendrag-Mondwhin). She presides over the Court of the Nine Moons on the Seanchan continent. She is Tuon's mother.

name: The Prophet of the Dragon
info: Title given [Masema](#Masema-Dagar) as the self-appointed bringer of the news of the Rebirth of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon). He is not necessarily sane anymore, but has gained a very large following. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) is getting to the point where he plans to do something about him, and just sent [Perrin](#Lord-Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) to Ghealdan with a few of the Asha'man and some of the sworn Aes Sedai to bring him in line.

name: Theodrin Dabei
info: Slim, apple-cheeked Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She was among the four raised to full sisterhood by [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere). Before being raised, she tried to dismantle [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran)'s block without success.

name: Therava
info: Wise One of the Shaido Aiel. She is stronger than any Aes Sedai in the White Tower. She was the one who captured [Galina Casban](#Galina-Casban) after the battle at Dumai's Wells.

name: Thomdril (Thom) Merrilin
info: A gleeman who came to Emond's Field on Winternight just before the Trollocs came. He is quite the ladies' man. Thom is good at juggling, sleight-of-hand, and all kinds of other tricks. He also carries several concealed knives up his sleeves, in his boots, and in various other locations on his body; this practice seems to have spread from Thom to [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw), and [Faile](#Lady-Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara). Thom was originally a bard in [Queen Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand)'s Royal Court, and for a time after her husband Taringail Damodred died, he was the Queen's lover. During his run from a Fade at Shadar Logoth, he was injured, and now walks with a limp because of it. Thom is getting old, such that he is starting to realize that he cannott do the backflips and other stunts he used to do. He accompanied [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) on their travels as per [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred)'s request, despite the fact that he has never felt comfortable around Aes Sedai since his nephew, Owyn, was gentled by the Red Ajah. Thom is an expert in the Game of Houses; in fact, his girlfried Dena was killed by Cairhienin soldiers because they thought he was trying to play _Daes Daemar_ against the Royal House.

name: Tialin
info: Lanky, red-haired Wise One. She can channel.

name: Tiam of Gazar
info: Person who proposed the Gazaran Calendar, which celebrated the alleged freedom from the Trolloc threat by recording Free Years (FY). This calendar was adopted due to the chaos the resulted during the Trolloc Wars and the resulting confusion as to which year it actually was under the Toman Calendar.

name: Tiana Noselle
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah. She serves as [Mistress of Novices](#Mistress-of-Novices) among the Aes Sedai who fled the White Tower.

name: Tion
info: Wise One of the Shaido Aiel, loyal to [Sevanna](#Sevanna).

name: Toma dur Ahmid
info: Person who devised the Toman Calendar, which was adopted approximately two hundred years after the death of the last male Aes Sedai and continued until the Trolloc Wars. The Calendar recorded years After the Breaking, or AB.

name: Tomas
info: Warder bonded to [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin). He is old and haggard, but still quite spry.

name: Toveine Gazal
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah. She is short and plump with smooth, coppery skin and long, glossy dark hair and dark eyes. She was given twenty years penance, and spent fifteen years away from the Tower until [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) summoned her back to active service. She was formerly a Sitter for the Red. Elaida named her to lead the team of fifty sisters that she sent to Caemlyn to attempt to capture any men who can channel that they find; unfortunately, she vastly underestimated their numbers, and the entire team will most likely be killed or captured in minutes once the Asha'man realize what they intend to do. It is too late to call her back, however.

name: Traveler
info: [Gareth Bryne](#Lord-Gareth-Bryne)'s sturdy gelding.

name: Tsorovan'm'hael
info: In the Old Tongue, “Storm Leader.” [Charl Gedwyn](#Charl-Gedwyn) uses the title among the Asha'man with him.

name: Turanna Norill
info: Aes Sedai of the White Ajah. She has no Warders. She was taken prisoner by [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and the Aiel.

name: Tylin Quintara Mitsobar
info: By the Grace of the Light, Queen of Altara, Mistress of the Four Winds, Guardian of the Sea of Storms, High Seat of House Mitsobar. Her kingdom is small, and she only rules a portion of it; the rest is governed by nobles who are not necessarily loyal to her. She is the second from her House to sit on the throne—this is the maximum traditionally, and the only House to hold it for four generations fell so fast from power that it could not recover. She is advised by [Merilille Ceandevin](#Merilille-Ceandevin) of the Gray Ajah. She is a widow, and does not plan to marry again, although she is always on the lookout for a lover....

name: Uno Nomesta
info: A Shienaran officer who accompanied the Emond's Fielders away from Shienar. He is the one who gave orders to [Masema](#Masema-Dagar) before he became the [Prophet](#The-Prophet-of-the-Dragon). He is missing one eye, has a long scar across his face, and has a hairstyle like the typical Shienaran warrior—a topknot tied together and the rest of the head shaved clean. He is currently commanding a unit in [Gareth Bryne](#Lord-Gareth-Bryne)'s army.

name: Uren din Jubai Soaring Gull
info: Sea Folk scholar and deviser of the [Farede](#Farede) Calendar, which measured dates from the arbitrarily set end of the War of the Hundred Years as years of the New Era (NE). This calendar is currently in use.

name: Vandene Namelle
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah, one of two Aes Sedai who went into voluntary retreat many years ago to Tifan's Well, a village located in the grassy plains of Arafel, along with her sister [Adeleas](#Adeleas-Namelle). Their goal was some day to write the complete history of the World since the Breaking, and some even before that. Vandene and Adeleas have since come to Salidar to escape [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan)'s summons back to the Tower. They now travel with the Aes Sedai, Accepted, novices, and troops on their way to Tar Valon.

name: Varek
info: Skinny under-lieutenant who [Miraj](#Captain-General-Kennar-Miraj) sends to fetch reports from his scouts.

name: Varil Nensen
chapter: Chapter 23: Fog of Ware, Storm of Battle
info: Young Soldier with thick mustaches.

name: Varilin
info: Red-haired Sitter for the Gray Ajah in the rebel Hall. She is inches taller than most men. She sits on [Romanda](#Romanda-Cassin)'s side.

name: Velina Behar
info: Sitter for the White Ajah in Tar Valon. She is cool and precise, has an almost girlishly high-pitched voice, a beak of a nose, and sharp, tilted eyes. She is a model of a White sister.

name: Verin Mathwin
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah who accompanied [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), and [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) back from Falme to Tar Valon. Her Warder is named [Tomas](#Tomas). She is more interested in current events than the average Brown; most of them could not care less what happens now, only what happened years ago. She gave Egwene the twisted stone ring _ter'angreal_ to assist her in Dreaming, and also once told [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) that there was really no need to keep her in the Tower until she learned to control her ability when she was a novice, since she would never be able to do much with it anyway. When Verin went to the Two Rivers with [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani), they helped to fight the Trollocs that attacked, and when they left they brought a half-dozen young women with them who could channel, including [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s sister Bode. When she and Alanna reached Caemlyn, they found that the Tower had been broken, and decided to side with the Salidar embassy when it reached town. Verin is quite old—her hair is starting to turn gray, which to an Aes Sedai means she is quite old indeed. Verin is a native of Far Madding.

name: Vinchova
info: One of the male channelers who sides with [Logain](#Logain-Ablar); he helped put down the Aes Sedai “invasion.”

name: Wing
info: [Sheriam](#Sheriam-Bayanar)'s horse.

name: Yukiri
